theory_decisions.rationale: This theory directly aligns with the existing model's focus on contributor progression from novice to core, providing a conceptual framework for understanding the social learning processes that drive skill development and community integration.

The SECI model's knowledge conversion processes complement the existing knowledge transfer variables but need adaptation to fit open-source community context, focusing on how tacit and explicit knowledge interact in distributed collaboration.

clustering_strategy.rationale: Clusters organized around core community development processes, separating knowledge dynamics from contributor progression while maintaining logical flow between learning, participation, and advancement.

clusters.name: Knowledge Dynamics
clusters.theme: Processes of knowledge creation, sharing, and conversion within the community
clusters.rationale: Centralizes all knowledge-related processes from both theories, creating a cohesive understanding of how knowledge flows and transforms in the community
clusters.spatial_recommendation: Position centrally in region (500-800, 200-500) - available space and central connectivity to other clusters

clusters.name: Contributor Progression
clusters.theme: Movement of contributors through different participation levels and roles
clusters.rationale: Groups all variables related to contributor advancement through community roles, reflecting the journey from periphery to core participation
clusters.spatial_recommendation: Place in region (200-500, 500-800) - adjacent to Knowledge cluster with good capacity

clusters.name: Community Engagement
clusters.theme: Social participation and shared practice development within the community
clusters.rationale: Focuses on the social cohesion and engagement aspects that sustain community participation and reduce turnover
clusters.spatial_recommendation: Position in region (200-500, 200-500) - isolated region suitable for engagement-focused variables

layout_hints: Place Knowledge Dynamics cluster centrally as it connects to both Contributor Progression and Community Engagement clusters
Position Contributor Progression and Community Engagement clusters adjacent to each other since they share turnover and progression dynamics
Maintain Knowledge cluster between the other two clusters to minimize crossing connections

inter_cluster_connections.note: Knowledge processes directly enable skill development and promotion through learning and mentorship
Progression levels influence turnover rates and community participation patterns
Community participation enables knowledge sharing and socialization processes

spatial_context.spatial_summary:

  - (200-500, 500-800): capacity ~9 variables (isolated region)
  - (200-500, 800-1100): capacity ~9 variables (isolated region)
  - (200-500, 1100-1400): capacity ~9 variables (isolated region)
  - (500-800, 200-500): capacity ~9 variables (isolated region)
